title: Adversarial Perturbations Maximization in Online Social Networks_supp1-3646453.pdf
authors: Dongyu Mao
abstract: Seeding conflict in online society is a public issue obtaining increasing attention. In this paper, we take a step to study the problem of maximizing conflict in online social networks from the adversarial perspective. More specifically, we combine the widely used stochastic information propagation model and opinion dynamics model to jointly model the processes of adversarial content propagation and opinion evolution through peer pressure on social networks, based on which we define the adversarial perturbations maximization (APM) problem. The APM problem focuses on two popular network conflict measures, disagreement and polarization. Our analysis begins by showing the complex nature of the APM problem. We show that by decomposing the objective into a subtraction of two set functions, an upper bound of the objective which is essentially a difference of two submodular (DS) functions can be devised. Then inspired by the success of modular-modular procedure and reverse influence sampling technique in related optimization tasks, we build a two-level approximation framework to maximize the upper bound heuristically with a data-dependent guarantee and further strengthen the approximation result using the sandwich approximation framework. Also, we apply dimension reduction technique to design a faster naïve greedy algorithm for the objective. Experiments show both the seriousness of this problem and the performance of our proposed algorithms.

title: A study on a flexible architecture system for relay protection intelligent operation and maintenance
authors: Jiang Yu, Zebing Shi, Changfu Yang, Honghui Gao, Yuan Cheng, Yuxiang Huang, Liwei Wang
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Power System and Power Engineering (PSPE)
abstract: To enhance relay protection operation and maintenance, a cloud-edge collaborative architecture integrating AI, IoT, and big data technologies is proposed. This flexible, hierarchical system emphasizes open sharing and secure scalability. Key contributions include organizing full-chain functional modules, developing multi-strategy collaboration mechanisms, and implementing containerized parallel processing. The system supports large-scale data acquisition from substations and standard-compliant communication via IEC 61850. Tests show significant improvements in intelligence, processing efficiency, and reliability, facilitating stable power grid operation.

title: Consideration of Emergency Power Restoration Strategies for Distribution Grids after Disasters Involving Distributed Photovoltaic Power Generation and Grid-Connected Energy Storage Systems
authors: Guoyu Yin, Bingqing Duan, Shankun Ye
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Computer Technology (IC2ECT)
abstract: With the widespread adoption of distributed energy sources, distribution grids face increasingly complex challenges in restoring power after disasters. This paper proposes a multisource collaborative emergency power restoration strategy that integrates distributed photovoltaic (PV) systems and grid-forming energy storage in response to large-scale line damage caused by typhoon disasters. First, to address the uncertainty in PV output following typhoon disasters, a model is established to assess the availability of PV systems based on prediction errors and damage rates; Second, an islanding division method is proposed based on load level weights to prioritize the restoration of critical loads; finally, a multi-source collaborative optimization dispatch strategy is proposed with the objectives of maximizing load restoration rates and minimizing economic costs. Case study analysis results based on the IEEE 33-node system demonstrate that this strategy can increase load restoration rates by $32.21 \%$ while controlling costs, validating the feasibility and practical value of the proposed method.

title: A Self-Contained Configurable and Explainable Rule-Based Recommendation System Suitable For Deployment on Low-Resource Shared Web Hosting
authors: Mirco Soderi, John Gerard Breslin
abstract: Artificial intelligence (AI) is often associated with articulated services offered by cloud service providers that require specialised expertise to be used effectively and efficiently and involve charges per subscription, per resource usage, or both. However, small businesses might not be in a position to make significant investments in infrastructure, specialist staff, and cloud services. In this work, we propose a configurable rule-based expert system that delivers a sorted list of motivated recommendations based on data submitted through a web survey service and, most importantly, entirely implemented in PHP and deployable to a basic shared web hosting service, which the vast majority of companies, even the smallest ones, such as single-person brokerage companies, are already using to have a presence on the Internet. This has the potential to impact social sustainability, making AI technologies accessible to a broader variety of business players and to their customers, and to impact environmental sustainability by making the identification of the right provider for the right client less expensive from all the different points of view. Software artefacts are available on GitHub that can be used for demo purposes and as a starting point for the development of customised systems.

title: Multi-Dimensional Optimization of A-Star Algorithm and Its Integration with Improved Dynamic Window Approach for Dynamic Path Planning
authors: Fengming Wang, Jihui Geng, Shengjie Xu, Qingxi Liu, Fusheng Zhao, Chengye Liu, Xiangdong Li
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Computer Technology (IC2ECT)
abstract: Path planning has significant application value in robot navigation, game development, and geographic information systems. While the traditional $\mathrm{A}^{*}$ algorithm works well in static environments, it has path redundancy, insufficient safety, and poor adaptability to dynamic environments. This paper proposes multidimensional optimization of $\mathrm{A}^{*}$, including a 5-direction search strategy based on target orientation, heuristic function optimization with obstacle factors, and a quadratic smoothing method for path post-processing. These enhancements significantly improve path smoothness, safety, and computational efficiency. Furthermore, the optimized $\mathbf{A}^{*}$ is combined with an improved DWA algorithm to build a global-local collaborative path planning framework for obstacle avoidance in dynamic/unknown environments. Simulation results show the proposed method outperforms traditional ones in path length, turn count, traversed node count, and safety, verifying its effectiveness and practicality.

title: An Interference Suppression Beamforming Method for Sparse Circular Arrays Based on the Joint UDL and CPSO Algorithms
authors: Kun Guo, Xiang Gao, Wenfei Tang, Yuesong Ding, Xiangyuan Bu, Jianping An
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: This paper proposes an interference suppression beamforming method for sparse circular arrays (SCAs) based on the joint updated diagonal loading (UDL) and combined particle swarm optimization (CPSO) algorithms. The UDL algorithm mitigates the adverse impacts of improper diagonal loading factor selection on beamforming by delineating its allowable value range. The CPSO algorithm employs chaotic map and updating velocity weight to expedite convergence, meanwhile incorporating cross-mutation strategy to overcome susceptibility to local optima entrapment. Simulation results demonstrate that the CPSO algorithm achieves approximately 90% faster convergence than the conventional PSO algorithm. For a full 25-element array with a sparsity ratio of 44%, the SCA-based beamforming suppresses interference signals to be less than -30 dB while maintaining good radiation directivity. This approach effectively reduces element number and system cost while delivering significant interference suppression. Furthermore, under the condition of six-user access, the sparse circular array remains high beam sharpness and interference suppression more than 20 dB, confirming excellent antiinterference characteristics.

title: ResNet 50: A Convolutional Neural Network Technology for Corn Leaf Disease Recognition
authors: Aeri Rachmad, Fifin Ayu Mufarroha, Yuli Panca Asmara, Husni, Eka Mala Sari Rochman, Yoga Dwitya Pramudita
publish: 2025 7th International Conference on Cybernetics and Intelligent System (ICORIS)
abstract: The development of artificial intelligence (AI) has opened new opportunities in precision agriculture, particularly in plant disease detection through digital imagery. Corn, as a major food commodity, is highly susceptible to various leaf diseases that can reduce productivity and threaten food security. Manual diagnostic methods are often inefficient, time-consuming, and prone to subjective errors, necessitating a fast and accurate automated detection system. This study applies deep learning techniques with the ResNet-50 Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) architecture to classify corn leaf conditions into four categories: healthy, leaf spot, blight, and common rust. ResNet-50 was chosen because it can overcome the problem of decreasing accuracy in deeper networks through residual connections, allowing for more effective image feature extraction. The model was trained with hyperparameter settings such as learning rate, batch size, optimizer, and number of epochs to achieve optimal performance. The test results showed excellent performance with 96% accuracy on the training data and 94% on the validation data, indicating the model's robustness and generalization ability.

title: A Fully Passive Robot Gripper with the Grass-Hopper Mechanism for Pinching and Scooping in Environmental Constraints
authors: Xinru Yao, Wenzeng Zhang
publish: 2025 International Conference on Advanced Robotics and Mechatronics (ICARM)
abstract: The movement of robot hands under environmental constraints has become a problem with the development of humanoid robots. Conventional industrial grippers are capable of gripping regularly shaped objects in parallel. The gripping effect on flat-shaped objects is poor. This paper proposes a novel robotic hand (PS Hand) with parallel pinching and scooping. This PS Hand combines the Grasshopper mechanism and the double parallelogram mechanism, with three phalanges similar to a human hand, and has three gripping modes: parallel pinching, scooping and adaptation. This proposed hand allows compound gripping, as the hand passively presses down, collides with the desktop, and the table and fingers interact, after the hand is pressed down to a certain height, the parallel pinching can be automatically converted to the scooping. When gripping flat objects such as cards, it can be effectively clamped by flipping the objects. At the same time, the adaptive gripping of this hand is suitable for grabbing objects of different shapes and sizes on the desktop. The setting of compound gripping allows it to grasp irregular objects. This paper analyzes both the kinematics and dynamics of this hand. Combined with the experiments, it is shown that this hand can have a good grasping effect and stable performance.

title: Human Dance Generation Via Text-Music Integration
authors: Yedong Zhang, Lingfeng Zhang, Tao Hu, Jun Li
publish: 2025 International Conference on Advanced Robotics and Mechatronics (ICARM)
abstract: Generative artificial intelligence has demonstrated strong application capabilities and prospects in multimedia editing. The goal of text-based 3D human dance generation is to produce 3D dance motions from text prompts, with the main challenge being the preservation of semantic consistency between text and motion. We augmented the existing Text-toDance framework by incorporating a Text-to-Music module as a new modality, resulting in an enhanced quality of generated dance motions. The audio craft model generates a particular style for our music generation. VTM uses a cross-modal transformer to generate motion codes aligned with the relevant dance motion representations in the embedding space to obtain quantized features and generate the dance. The motion codes are synthesized by leveraging the beat information of the music, which is obtained through transforming the semantic content of the text into beat-related features. Following an encoderdecoder architecture, the cross-modal Transformer employs a multi-head attention mechanism internally to effectively capture element-wise dependencies between audio features. Extensive experimental evaluations have been conducted, demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed VTM architecture. Results on the public AIST++ and HumanML3D datasets indicate that the added text-to-music modality facilitates the generation of human dance poses, outperforming previous methods in quantitative and qualitative evaluations.

title: Engaging Safety-Critical Operators in Visualization Design
authors: Elmira Zohrevandi, Aida Nordman, Anders Ynnerman, Jonas Lundberg, Carl A. L. Westin, Katerina Vrotsou
publish: 2025 IEEE Conference on Engaging Critical Workforce In co-Design aNd Assessment (ECWIDNA)
abstract: Air traffic control is an example of safety-critical domain where operators’ decision making is crucial for enhancing safety. Visualization tools can help air traffic controllers not just to maintain safety of flights but to manage traffic complexity. Our recent research in visual analytics has demonstrated clear benefits for identifying mapping patterns of ATCos and also for supporting them in critical decision-making tasks, i.e., conflict detection and resolution and complexity management. Yet the ultimate effectiveness of our research hinges on the collaborative engagement of the critical workforce—air traffic controllers—in their co-design and evaluation. In this position paper, we share insights gathered from design and evaluation studies conducted with more than 30 fully-licensed and operational air traffic controllers to propose a principled approach for meaningful application domain expert participation in work pattern analysis and visualization design for air traffic control. We present the unique challenges these operators face, and outline methods and outcomes of successful co-design processes resulting in a forward-looking research agenda.

title: Artificial Intelligence and Islamic Ethical Guidelines: A Systematic Review
authors: Zulkifli, Dhea Urfina Zulkifli, Donald Qomaidiasyah Tungkagi
publish: 2025 13th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management (CITSM)
abstract: Artificial Intelligence (AI) presents a paradox for Muslim societies, offering transformative opportunities alongside complex challenges. This research, employing a Systematic Literature Review (SLR) of 22 selected articles, identifies that AI has the potential to enhance efficiency in the fields of education, Hajj management, economics, and public services. However, conversely, AI also poses nine multidimensional challenges encompassing epistemological, theological, jurisprudential (fiqh), ethical, social, and cultural identity aspects. Key challenges include the erosion of religious authority, academic plagiarism, algorithmic bias, privacy violations, and the degradation of spiritual values. This paper concludes that Islam offers a moderate and comprehensive normative framework for navigating this duality. Based on a synthesis of the literature, eight Islamic ethical guidelines for AI are formulated, centered on two main foundations: Maqāṣid alShariī'ah (the five objectives of Shariah) and the principle of Wasathiyyah (moderation). These guidelines emphasize legitimacy, justice, data protection, human accountability, integrity, and sustainability. Thus, this paper argues that the responsible integration of AI requires a balanced approach that harnesses its technological benefits while rigorously ensuring its alignment with Islamic values and law.

title: A Compliance Control Approach Based on Dual-Channel Modal Fusion Perception During Human-Robot Cooperation
authors: Pengwen Xiong, Jun Li, Yu Zhang, Weiping Zhang
publish: 2025 International Conference on Advanced Robotics and Mechatronics (ICARM)
abstract: In this paper, we present a new compliance control approach for human-robot cooperation during cooperative tasks. In our human-robot cooperation system, an MYO arm ring in the human side is used to capture Surface Electromyography (SEMG) signals and the related interactive motion information, and an advanced force sensor in the robot side is used to capture six-dimensional forces at the end effector. In order to fuse the different modalities during the human-robot cooperation system, a time-loop neural network-based Long Short Term Memory (LSTM) approach is used to optimize the entire cooperation process by fusing the motion information modality generated by the human with the force-aware information modality generated from the robot. Three models were developed using LSTM network: two trained separately on the modal data from individual channels and one trained on the fused dual-channel modal data. A cooperative handling object task is specially conducted to verify our compliance control approach via the response force and response time. The results demonstrate that the proposed approach effectively reduces response latency in human-robot collaboration while improving the system's robustness against unintended activations caused by non-human collaborators.

title: Nonlinearity Mitigation in Optical Fiber Transmission Using Quaternion-Valued Neural Networks: An Experimental Study
authors: K. Ochiri, T. Sakamoto, N. Yamamoto, M. Nakamura
abstract: We propose a novel optical nonlinearity compensation scheme based on a quaternion-valued neural network. Its performance was demonstrated through both numerical simulations and experiments in 40-Gb/s 16QAM optical transmission. Results show improved computational efficiency and faster learning compared to conventional neural-networkbased schemes.

title: Power-Time Series Characterisation of Heterogeneous ARM/RISC-V Cores Under Normal and Anomalous Workloads
authors: Evan Healy, Dominic Lightbody, Colin Murphy, Emanuel Popovici
abstract: With the increasing deployment of embedded systems in security-critical applications, Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) have become an essential defense mechanism. However, integrating IDS into resource-constrained environments, particularly across heterogeneous processor architectures such as ARM and RISC-V, presents significant challenges. This study performs a comparative analysis of ARM and RISC-V architectures using power-time series measurements to evaluate their suitability for anomaly-based intrusion detection. The analysis was conducted on the MAX78002 development platform using controlled anomaly injection scenarios designed to simulate abnormal system behaviour. Power consumption patterns were captured and analysed using DTW and Normalised Cross-Correlation metrics to detect deviations indicative of potential intrusion events. The results revealed that RISC-V cores exhibited greater sensitivity to anomaly-induced deviations, while ARM cores produced more consistent power patterns under anomalous conditions. Additionally, ARM anomalies had a more pronounced impact in concurrent core scenarios, suggesting asymmetric observability across architectures. These findings highlight the significant role of processor architecture in the design of effective, power-aware IDS solutions.

title: Digital Twin-Enabled Condition Monitoring System for Excavator Bucket: A Case Study
authors: Adil Hammadi, Zeeshan Ahmad, Jamshaid Ashraf
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on E-Business Engineering (ICEBE)
abstract: In the mining industry, the reactive maintenance of mining equipment significantly affects miners, original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), and aftermarket parts suppliers financially. This paper aims to design a conceptual architecture for a proposed digital twin-based condition monitoring system for predictive maintenance, grounded in a case study. The design is organised into three groups of technologies: operational technologies, data transmission and storage technologies, and digital twin technology. These technologies are integrated to provide a real-time or near realtime condition assessment of mining equipment, enabling advanced planning for maintenance. The implementation of this system will yield financial benefits for all stakeholders, including miners, OEMs, and parts suppliers.

title: A Novel Numerical Method for Cable Electromagnetic Radiation Prediction
authors: Ying Xi, Ying Wang, Wen Shi, Jian Wang
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: Traditional analytical and numerical methods are limited for cable radiation analysis in complex field-space environments, especially for the cable case with complex circuit loads. This paper proposes a novel hybrid method by combining transmission line (TL) theory and the finite difference time domain (FDTD) method together. Distributed cable currents, obtained by solving TL equations via 1D FDTD, are injected as discrete sources into the 3D FDTD to solve Maxwell's equations. Results validate the method against dipole approximation and commercial full wave software. Compared with the analytical and the full-wave numerical methods, the proposed method has obvious advantages in terms of cable routing dependence, load complexity and computational efficiency.

title: A Low Cross Polarized Frequency Scanning Antenna Fed by Spoof Surface Plasmon Polariton
authors: Chao Han, Xiaoming Chen, Huaqiang Gao
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: This paper presents a wide frequency scanning antenna fed by spoof surface plasmon polariton (SSPP). The radiating elements consist of split-ring resonators (SRRs) incorporating choke rings, specifically designed to suppress cross-polarization inherent in conventional SRRs. The antenna is fed using a substrate integrated waveguide (SIW) to microstrip transition. The proposed structure exhibits excellent radiation characteristics, including a wide scanning range, low gain variation, and low cross-polarization. Simulation results using CST demonstrate an operating bandwidth from 24.4 GHz to 32 GHz. The antenna achieves an average gain of 10.5 dBi, with gain variation throughout the scanning range constrained within 3 dB. The integration of choke rings significantly improves cross-polarization levels, enhancing the worst-case cross-pol from approximately -2 dB to near -10 dB across the band. These results validate the effectiveness of the choke-ring-loaded SRR design in reduction of cross-polarization.

title: MMPR: Multi-ASV Multi-Stage Pre-Set Time Roundup Control Method for Multi-View Coordinated Observation
authors: Xiaochen Qin, Qiankun Sun, Lei Cai
publish: 2025 International Conference on Advanced Robotics and Mechatronics (ICARM)
abstract: Large-scale wake vortices will be left behind during the voyage of an underwater vehicle, and the information collection of dynamically spreading wake vortices by multiple ASVs through multiple viewpoints can help to track the underwater vehicle. However, the communication distance between low-cost ASVs is limited, and the wake vortex is in the process of spreading continuously, so it is necessary to form a full encirclement of the wake vortex within a preset time. In this paper, the multi-view information acquisition problem of the wake vortex is transformed into an encirclement problem with limited preset time and communication distance. In this paper, Multi-ASV multi-stage pre-set time roundup control method for multi-view coordinated observation(MMPR) is introduced. Firstly, an ASV kinematic model is established, and the time threshold for roundup is determined according to the diffusion nature of the trailing vortex and the roundup capability. Then, the encirclement path is generated and optimised by combining the B-spline curve with the collision penalty function. Finally, the orientation-based multi-ASV preset time interference observer, formation controller and encirclement controller are designed. In this paper, the formation, tracking and encircling three-phase control method is used to achieve the accurate encirclement of dynamic trailing vortex floating targets, and the simulation experiments show the effectiveness of this paper's algorithm.

title: Integrated Position Optimization of a Drilling Robot Based on Stiffness Projection
authors: Yibo Liu, Chaoqun Wu, Shiyu Cao, Wenjian Huang, Minghui Yang
publish: 2025 International Conference on Advanced Robotics and Mechatronics (ICARM)
abstract: Industrial robots have been broadly used in machining applications, but low-stiffness characteristics limit further development; therefore, accurate evaluation and optimisation of the robot end stiffness are required. In the case of drilling robots, the current stiffness evaluation metrics do not visually evaluate the stiffness of the robot end in any tool axis, and positional optimisation criteria are not proposed for continuous drilling operations. To improve the machining quality and efficiency of drilling robots, this paper introduces a comprehensive position optimisation technique for drilling robots. Firstly, a stiffness performance index represents the axial force in any robot direction. Secondly, the robot's comprehensive position optimisation model is established by considering the effects of configuration invariance and singularity on machining. Enhancing the robot's drilling quality ensures working efficiency and stability under continuous operation. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed method is verified by drilling experiments, which reduces the robot drilling processing defects.

title: Performance Evaluation of RFE-CV, Class Weights, and ADASYN for Network Attack Classification on UNSW-NB15 Using Ensemble Learning
authors: Arini, Hidayat, Andrew Fiade
publish: 2025 13th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management (CITSM)
abstract: Multiclass network attack classification presents significant challenges due to the imbalanced distribution of data. So far, no existing studies have explicitly combined three main approaches: Recursive Feature Elimination with CrossValidation (RFE-CV), Class Weights, and Adaptive Synthetic Sampling (ADASYN) within a single evaluation framework. This study evaluates the combination of these techniques on the UNSW-NB15 dataset using the XGBoost, LightGBM, and CatBoost models. The results reveal a trade-off. While the full combination of techniques improves the recall of the minority class Backdoor to 0.88, it also reduces the performance of other classes. Model interpretation using SHAP confirms that this trade-off arises from the similarity of feature characteristics between classes such as Exploits and DoS and minority classes like Analysis and Backdoor. Considering the need for stable overall performance, this study concludes that the combination of RFE-CV and Class Weights with the XGBoost model provides the most balanced approach, achieving an F1-Macro score of 0.58 and an accuracy of 0.76, which indicates that although the overall accuracy decreased compared to the baseline, the unchanged F1-Macro reflects a trade-off where performance on majority classes dropped while detection of minority classes improved.

title: Generation of High-Purity Vortex Beams via Genetic Algorithm-Optimized Plasmonic Metasurfaces
authors: Xinyu Ma, Wenjie Guo, Qing’An Sun, Hang Yu, Lixia Yang
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: Visible-wavelength vortex beams (VBs) generated by plasmonic metasurfaces exhibit enormous application potential in the field of optical information transmission. However, achieving perfect multiplexing and superposition of VBs with different orders remains challenging. This paper proposes a single-layer metallic porous metasurface structure suitable for the visible light band. By rationally designing elliptical apertures arranged in a ring pattern, VBs with topological charges of l=2, 4, 6, and 8 are successfully generated. To obtain VBs with ideal wavefront quality, a genetic algorithm is employed in this study to optimize the key structural parameters of the metasurface. Meanwhile, leveraging the intrinsic orthogonality of VBs with different topological charges, concentric ring-shaped multi-channel VBs arrays (l=2, 6) and (l=4, 8) with high purity (>90%) are constructed. This research provides an innovative approach for advancing the development of high-capacity optical information transmission and high-security optical communication encryption technologies.

title: Photonics Based Ultra Wideband Reactive Jamming of Unauthorized Radio Channels
authors: Thejna Ros Joseph, Chiranjeevi Damacherla, Ranu Tyagi, Pushpalata T
abstract: The dynamic nature of unauthorized radio transmissions demands a highly responsive jamming solution. We demonstrate a microwave photonics architecture based on line-broadened modulation for ultra-wideband frequency agile jamming, experimentally evaluating its performance against interference technique. Key metrics include EVM, 5G testbed synchronization and spectral characteristics.

title: A Low-Cost Ferrite Permeability Measurements Based on Coaxial Transmission Line Model
authors: Lingfeng Xue, Lei Xing, Qian Xu, Yijie Wang, Qianlong Gao
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: In this paper, a fast and efficient permeability measurement method for ferrite core is presented. By measuring the reflection coefficient of the short-circuited coaxial cavity, the permeability of the ferrite core can be determined. Precise analytical expressions for the ferrite permeability are derived through the equivalent transmission line model. Both simulations and measurements are conducted, the operational range of the relative error below 10% has been established. It can be used for precise permeability measurement of ferrite core.

title: TEOM: An Extensible Decentralized Operating Protocol for Intelligent Enterprise Systems
authors: Keyhan Mohammadi, Reza Ebrahimi Atani
publish: 2025 9th Iranian Conference on Advances in Enterprise Architecture (ICAEA)
abstract: This paper presents TEOM (The Evolutionary Open Machine), a decentralized operating protocol designed for smart enterprise architecture. TEOM enables secure, scalable, and flexible integration across diverse organizational functions, from AI and IoT to finance and governance. By applying a combination of Hashgraph and blockchain technologies, TEOM provides a robust framework for decentralized service delivery, real time data sharing, and multi organization collaboration. It supports the creation of autonomous, fault tolerant ecosystems that scale effortlessly, ensuring high availability and fault resistance across distributed networks. TEOM’s extensibility allows seamless integration of legacy systems and third-party platforms, promoting interoperability within smart enterprise environments. The protocol also integrates advanced AI capabilities for intelligent decision making, predictive analytics, and federated learning. Through automated service provisioning and decentralized transaction management, TEOM fosters an agile, transparent, and adaptive framework for modern enterprise architecture, empowering organizations to operate efficiently in a zero-trust environment.

title: Integrated Circuit Level Narrow Spectrum High Power Microwave Test Method Research
authors: Wei Song, Xing Liu, Shiyue Wu, Jun Chen, Yunfeng Qiu, Jianjing Zhou, Yu Zhao, Xingwang Hou
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: In this paper, a test method based on microstrip design and multi-port co-injection is proposed to aiming at the multi-port coupling effect of integrated circuits in high-power microwave environment. Through theoretical analysis and simulation optimization, a dual-frequency (2.4 GHz/5 GHz) microstrip structure is designed, with good characteristic impedance matching (S<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">11</inf><25dB, S<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">21</inf>>-0.2dB, VSWR <1.15), and a trapezoidal transition structure is used to achieve efficient impedance matching between the microstrip and the chip pins. In order to solve the problem of mutual interference between RF and DC signals, a combination scheme of decoupling capacitance (0.6 pF) and filtering inductor (10 nH) is proposed, and an integrated circuit test system containing three RF injection ports and a shared power supply port is constructed. The experimental scheme uses power amplifier, directional coupler and bandpass filtering to realize the combined injection of HPM signal and normal working signal, and uses vector network analyzer and peak power meter to monitor the response. This study provides a scalable test framework for the HPM front and rear gate coupling effect of integrated circuits, especially suitable for the anti-interference evaluation of RF devices such as low-noise amplifiers, and lays a methodological foundation for the protection design of integrated circuits in complex electromagnetic environments.

title: A Power Scene Instrument Segmentation Method Based on Vision Transformer
authors: Liang Huang, Hangzhou Du, Xingtuo Zhang, Chong Zeng, Li Wang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Computer Technology (IC2ECT)
abstract: Nowadays, a variety of intelligent technologies are gradually being introduced into power scenarios. In substations, intelligent inspection robots are increasingly replacing manual labor for patrol tasks. One of the primary focuses of robot patrols is the operating parameters of equipment, which requires accurate reading of parameters from various instruments. For pointer-type instruments, accurate segmentation is one of the key steps for automatic reading. To address this need, this paper proposes a method based on the Vision Transformer (ViT). Specifically, ViT is adopted as the backbone to extract image features more effectively, as it enables better capture of global information-a factor crucial for image segmentation tasks. To further enhance the capture of contextual information, a pyramid pooling module (PPM) is integrated into the feature pyramid. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method achieves competitive accuracy performance, with an mIoU value of $97.42 \%$. This method can provide valuable support for the subsequent steps of automatic reading for pointer-type instruments.

title: Anti-patterns Detection in Microservice-Based Software Architectures Using Graph Analysis
authors: Farid Ahmadpour Mobarakeh, Fereidoon Shams Aliee
publish: 2025 9th Iranian Conference on Advances in Enterprise Architecture (ICAEA)
abstract: Microservice architectures promise scalability, flexibility, and rapid delivery, yet their distributed nature makes them susceptible to architectural anti-patterns that erode maintainability, reliability, and performance. This paper presents a graph-based, runtime methodology for detecting such issues in systems orchestrated with Kubernetes and observed via the Istio service mesh. Leveraging mesh telemetry, we automatically construct a Service Dependency Graph (SDG) that captures inter-service communication and operational context; network-analysis metrics and structural queries are then applied to surface problematic architectural structures. The approach scales to large clusters, runs continuously, and requires neither static code inspection nor intrusive changes to application deployments. By turning production telemetry into actionable architectural signals, it enables early remediation and continuous governance of microservice systems.

title: Ultra-Wideband Balanced Band-Pass Filter Using Spoof Surface Plasmon Polaritons
authors: Yi Song, Qian Yang, MengRan Zhao, Hong Yuan, Gang Liu, AnXue Zhang
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: An ultra-wideband balanced band-pass filter (BPF) is proposed based on the spoof surface plasmon polaritons (SSPPs). Firstly, a I-shaped microstrip SSPP structure is proposed for introducing the upper cut-off frequency and achieving compact size. Then, a microstrip-to-slotline (MTS) transition feeding structure is used to introducing lower cut-off frequency, and an ultra-wideband balanced BPF is fabricated and measured. For differential mode (DM) operation, a filtering response with center frequency of 2.4 GHz and 3-dB fractional bandwidth of 116% is achieved. For common mode (CM) operation, the in-band CM suppression level is above 30 dB. The ultra-wideband balanced BPF shows controllable bandwidth and high CM suppression level.

title: A Back Radiation Suppressed Groundless Dual-Band Antenna for Wearable Applications
authors: Kai Zhang, Zhuoyue Li, Mingjun Wang
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: This paper presents a groundless dual-band antenna designed for wearable applications, featuring innovative back radiation suppression through a crossed-dipole configuration. Operating at 2.45 GHz and 5.5 GHz ISM bands, the antenna utilizes L-shaped etching on dipole arms to enable dual-frequency resonance. A fixed 180° phase inversion via cross-connected strip lines and spatial separation, d=10mm, creates destructive interference in the backward direction achieving front-to-back ratios (FBR) of 1.8 dB at 2.45 GHz and 15 dB at 5.5 GHz. Fabricated on low-permittivity felt substrate, the compact design (19.75×36.38×10mm<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">3</sup>) exhibits 480 MHz (fractional bandwidth of 19%) and 1820 MHz (fractional bandwidth of 33%) bandwidths, with realized gains of 2.34 dBi and 3.6 dBi, respectively. The groundless structure minimizes SAR, enhancing safety for on-body use.

title: A calibration method for spatial resolution of near field probe
authors: Hongchuan Jia, Fayu Wan, Xiaohe Chen, Blaise Ravelo, Dmitry Kholodnyak
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: This article proposed a resolution facor for characterizing the spatial resolution of near-field probes. This facor to some extent reduces the influence of the tested transmission line on the spatial resolution of the near-field probe obtained from the test, making it more representative of the spatial resolution capability of the near-field probe itself.

title: Evaluation of Geogebra Implementation in Schools: A Combined Tam and is Success Model Approach
authors: Muhammad Agreindra Helmiawan, Ucu Koswara, Yanyan Sofiyan, Yusfita Yusuf, Yopi Hidayatul Akbar, A'ang Subiyakto
publish: 2025 13th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management (CITSM)
abstract: This study evaluates the implementation of GeoGebra in mathematics education by integrating the Technology Acceptance Model and the Information Systems Success Model. The hybrid model enables a multifaceted assessment, capturing both user acceptance and the broader organisational impacts of the technology. Quantitative data, gathered through surveys and statistical analysis, measures GeoGebra adoption, perceived usefulness, and ease of use among teachers and students. Qualitative data, collected through interviews, focus groups, and classroom observations, provides insights into the experiences of teachers and students using GeoGebra. Data analysis involves descriptive and inferential statistics to compare user perceptions and examine the relationships between variables, such as the impact of perceived usefulness and system quality on user satisfaction and behavioural intention. The findings offer practical consequences for educational institutions and mathematics teachers wishing to successfully incorporate GeoGebra into their mathematics curriculum by addressing technical complexity and providing sufficient assistance.

title: Perception of Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises on the Use of Artificial Intelligence to Enhance Productivity and Marketing
authors: Dody Herdiana, Dani Indra Junaedi, Yopi Hidayatul Akbar, Fadila Nurfauzia, Risa Ratna Gumilang, Ayi Srie Yuniawati
publish: 2025 13th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management (CITSM)
abstract: This study investigates the adoption of artificial intelligence among micro, small, and medium enterprises in Indonesia using an extended Technology Acceptance Model. The framework includes perceived usefulness, perceived ease of use, awareness, external support, attitude toward use, and perceived adoption. Data from 300 respondents were analyzed using Partial Least Squares Structural Equation Modeling. The results indicate that perceived usefulness and ease of use significantly influence attitude, which in turn strongly predicts adoption. Although awareness and external support contribute positively, their reliability is limited. The overall adoption rate remains low, suggesting barriers such as limited resources and lack of technical guidance. This study provides practical recommendations to improve adoption through targeted training, financial assistance, and collaborative innovation ecosystems.

title: Scalable Hybrid OCR Framework for Structured Extraction of Textual Data From Cadastral Maps Using Deep Learning
authors: Veerendernath P, Udith Chandra Prasad P, Vinodh Kumar Minchula
publish: 2025 Third International Conference on Cyber Physical Systems, Power Electronics and Electric Vehicles (ICPEEV)
abstract: Cadastral maps are critical for land administration but usually exist as scanned images with low resolution, clutter, and inconsistent formatting that hinder machine readability and slow manual digitization. This paper presents a scalable hybrid OCR framework that combines MATLAB-based pre-processing (grayscale, contrast enhancement, and grid-based tiling) with a Python pipeline using EasyOCR for text recognition and fuzzy gazetteer-assisted correction. The system outputs structured CSV/Excel data for seamless GIS integration, enabling accurate extraction of place names and plot numbers from degraded maps. Unlike general-purpose OCR systems, the framework is specifically tailored for cadastral records, achieving higher recognition accuracy through its modular design, and can be adapted to other historical or administrative documents requiring text extraction and digitization.Experiments demonstrate significant improvements in recognition quality compared to baseline OCR engines.This Hybrid Ocr Framework offered a 8.4 percent WER which is significantly very low word error rate in comparison to other baseline Ocr engines. It also Performed Faster extraction in Comparison

title: The Role of Advertising Value as A Mediator of the Influence of Credibility and Informativeness on E-commerce Brand Image: A Study on Gen Z and Millennial Consumers
authors: Muhammad Daffa Maulana Hidayat, Farhan Aditya, Chyntia Ika Ratnapuri
publish: 2025 13th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management (CITSM)
abstract: Credibility and informativeness are important in an advertisement because they will affect brand image. Advertisements are a significant tool or medium to convey messages to consumers. A positive brand image will influence consumers’ perspectives on a brand, which will have a positive impact on consumer loyalty. However, there are still issues regarding the extent to which the credibility and informativeness of e-commerce advertisements play a role in shaping brand image through advertising value. This study aims to analyze the influence of e-commerce advertisements on brand image. This study was conducted using a quantitative survey method. The sample obtained online amounted to 223 samples. The results showed that credibility and informativeness significantly affect advertising value. However, credibility has more significant value than informativeness regarding advertising value. Advertising value has a significant effect on brand image. This study proves that understanding the value of an advertisement plays a crucial role in building brand image, thus enabling e-commerce business actors to develop effective marketing strategies that will positively impact their business. Therefore, this study is practical and theoretical in increasing knowledge about digital advertising, and in practice, it can help e-commerce actors create more effective advertising strategies. The systematics of writing this thesis consists of an introduction, a literature review, research methodology, results and discussion, and conclusions and suggestions.

title: Near-field Electromagnetic Radiation Analysis of the Main Control Board in an Electrical Cabinet
authors: Haoguang Xia, Qixin Mi, Zhenjiang Zhang, Yansong Huang, Zewei Wu, Jinling Zhang
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: This study examines the near-field radiation issues arising from the main control board of the electrical cabinets in high-speed trains operating within complex electromagnetic environments. A simulation model of the main control board was developed to analyze the near-field electric field radiation distributions of critical signals, including DDR3 data signals, address signals, and Ethernet signals. The simulation results indicate that the voltage of the DDR signal waveform ranges from 0V to 1.2V, with no significant jitter or overshoot. The rise and fall times of the signals satisfy design requirements and maintain signal integrity (SI). Furthermore, the near-field field strength of the main control board reaches a maximum of 38.492 V/m at 189.2 MHz, and the radiation distribution is consistent with theoretical predictions. These findings provide a theoretical foundation and practical engineering references for the electromagnetic compatibility design of electrical cabinets and similar onboard electronic devices.

title: Smart Safety Solution: Wearable Health Tracker with Cloud Based Alerts and Fall Detection
authors: Parkavi A, Vishnu Kumar K, Sheikh Mannan Javeed, Yashasvi Krishna, Chethan G A
publish: 2025 International Conference on Vehicular Technology and Transportation Systems (ICVTTS)
abstract: Cardiovascular and respiratory diseases constitute a global health crisis, with delayed intervention contributing significantly to mortality rates. Traditional monitoring methods prove inadequate for capturing critical physiological changes between clinical visits. This project addresses this unmet need through an IoT-based wearable system for continuous heart rate and SpO<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">₂</inf> monitoring, prioritizing accessibility for underserved populations. The solution was conceived to bridge technological disparities in healthcare, leveraging low-cost components without compromising clinical utility. Validation against medical-grade equipment demonstrated mean absolute errors of 1.8 bpm for heart rate and 1.9% for SpO<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">₂</inf> during controlled conditions. The system achieved 92% sensitivity in detecting critical events during simulated emergencies, with end-to-end alert latency under 60 seconds. Battery performance exceeded 8 hours during continuous operation. This project conclusively establishes a foundation for affordable remote patient monitoring, with future iterations focusing on regulatory certification and AI-enhanced predictive capabilities for proactive healthcare delivery.

title: sdA Novel Dipole Antenna Design with ESD Protection Function by Loading LC Resonator
authors: Zhi Xu, Shengping Huang, Kanglong Zhang, Yifeng Cheng
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: Electrostatic discharge (ESD) is a frequent source of electromagnetic interference, capable of causing significant damage to mobile devices. The failure or damage of electronic products due to ESD has led to considerable losses in the industry. To prevent damage, ESD protection devices are often installed between the antenna and sensitive circuits. However, these extra components can result in issues like impedance mismatch, lower efficiency, and higher costs. In this paper, a simple and efficient method using loaded microstrip-line based LC resonator is proposed. The ESD current can flow from the positive arm of the dipole to the negative arm and then to the ground. ESD protection is automatically realized without any additional devices. By simply adjusting the dimensions of the capacitor (C) and inductor (L) of the resonator, the LC resonator equivalent to an open-circuited condition at the operating frequency of the antenna, thus the performances of antennas are remained. This method can also be applied to other types of antennas.

title: Advancing Prediabetes Care with Personalised Conversational Agents
authors: Abdullah Bin Sawad, Mohammed Althubyani, Sultan A. Alharbi, Abdulrhman Alorini, Wael Jefry, Naif N. Alotaibi, Bhuva Narayan, Shanshan Lin, Mukesh Prasad, A. Baki Kocaballi
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on E-Business Engineering (ICEBE)
abstract: Type 2 diabetes (T2D) ranks among the leading chronic conditions globally, with 90 % of cases attributable to excess weight and sedentary lifestyles. Given the urgent need for cost-effective interventions that promote physical activity and diabetes awareness, this study introduces a chatbot prototype aimed at mitigating the growing prevalence of T2D by focusing on the physical activity dimension. Incorporating semi-structured interviews from Sydney and Jeddah, the study performed thematic analysis to garner insights into the participants' impressions, the chatbot's functionality, and potential improvements. Findings highlight the critical role of user-friendly design and personalised, interactive content in promoting health education through a mobile application. This research contributes by presenting actionable recommendations for chatbot development in healthcare to foster better health outcomes amidst rising T2D challenges. Offering personalised and context-aware interactions can uniquely enhance physical activity engagement in T2D management and showcase a novel approach to Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) for health promotion.

title: Asynchronous Quasi-Millimeter-Wave Electro-Optic Imaging System Using Polarization Image Sensor
authors: Ryoma Okada, Maya Mizuno, Hironari Takehara, Makito Haruta, Hiroyuki Tashiro, Jun Ohta, Kiyotaka Sasagawa
abstract: In this paper, we demonstrate an asynchronous electro-optic imaging system for the quasi-millimeter-wave band. By developing a local-oscillation modulated light generation system that tracks the frequency of the electric field to be observed, we have successfully imaged the electric field from a Doppler radar module.

title: Research on the Time-Frequency Evolution Law of Coal-Rock Electromagnetic Radiation Based on CPO-CNN-BiLSTM and Quadratic Decomposition
authors: Haoxing Huang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Computer Technology (IC2ECT)
abstract: This article proposes a warning method combining quadratic mode decomposition and optimized deep learning to address the issues of non-stationary, strong noise, and difficult feature extraction of electromagnetic radiation signals from loaded coal and rock in coal mine rockburst warning. The experiment takes the “rock coal rock” three-layer standard sample as the object, and uses the RTR-4600 rock mechanics system and NF-5035 electromagnetic instrument to collect EMR signals at loading rates of $0.3,0.4$, and $0.5 \mathrm{~mm} / \mathrm{min}$. Firstly, the original signal is decomposed using ICEEMDAN to obtain IMF and residual components. By combining sample entropy and Kmeans, IMF is classified into high, medium, and low frequency categories; $2=$ Then use VMD quadratic decomposition on highfrequency components to refine frequency characteristics; Finally, a CPO CNN BiLSTM model is constructed for training. The results showed that the $\mathbf{R}^{2}$ of all three operating conditions in the test set exceeded $95 \%$, with the lowest MAE of 0.33966 and the lowest MAPE of 0.057666; The ablation experiment confirmed that secondary decomposition and CPO optimization improved the model performance by $15 \%-83 \%$ compared to CNN and BiLSTM alone. This method can effectively capture the time-frequency evolution law of EMR signals, providing technical support for ground pressure warning.

title: Research on Multi-body Dynamics Modeling Method of Transmission Conductors Considering Tension-Torsion Coupling Characteristics
authors: Lixin Wang, Kaihua Liu, Zhanyu Yu, Liang Xiao, Zhuli Liu, Fuzhou Ai
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Power System and Power Engineering (PSPE)
abstract: This study proposes a novel multi-rigid-body flexible connection modeling methodology for transmission conductors, integrating McConnell’s tension-torsion constitutive equations within the Adams platform. By synergistically combining discrete rigid bodies with parametric force fields—transmitting fundamental stiffness via Bushing force elements and introducing cross-stiffness terms through custom torque elements—the method achieves precise characterization of tension-torsion coupling effects. A 200 mm gauge-length model of the LGJ/JL/G1A-70-10 conductor was validated against high-fidelity Ansys LS-DYNA finite element simulations. Comparative analysis demonstrated that the approach accurately replicates axial stiffness, torsional stiffness, and tension-induced torsional deformation. The proposed methodology addresses computational bottlenecks in large-span conductor modeling, offering an efficient paradigm for construction dynamics research and enabling proactive risk mitigation in overhead transmission line projects.

title: Parameter Optimization of Brushless DC Motor Control System Based on Improved Differential Evolution Algorithm
authors: Yang Li, Xiaodong Kang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Computer Technology (IC2ECT)
abstract: Addressing the issues of traditional PID parameter tuning methods in brushless DC motor control being cumbersome and time-consuming, and difficult to obtain optimal solutions. This study proposes the utilization of an improved differential evolution algorithm for PID controller design. The improved differential evolution algorithm sets weighted sum of overshoot, adjustment time, and integral of absolute error as the optimization cost function. To avoid the shortcoming of the standard differential evolution algorithm of easily falling into local optima, this algorithm introduces individuals outside the population and dynamic mutation coefficients in the mutation stage, and dynamic crossover factors in the crossover stage. To compare the performance of different parameter tuning methods, a brushless DC motor control system model was constructed using the Matlab/Simulink platform, and traditional PID methods, standard and improved differential evolution algorithms were applied to tune the PID parameters. Simulation results show that, compared with traditional methods and standard differential evolution algorithms, the PID parameters tuned by the improved algorithm presented in the present study demonstrate superior overall performance with respect to response speed, overshoot, and interference resistance, verifying its effectiveness and superiority.

title: High-Field Enhancement Isolator for 1.5T MRI Surface Coil-Metamaterial Decoupling
authors: Qun Ren, Munan Wang, Xiuyu Wang, Hao Huang, Yuxin Lang, Yanwei Pang
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: This paper presents a novel compact isolator designed to decouple surface coils from metamaterials in 1.5T MRI systems while dramatically enhancing the local magnetic field within the metamaterial. The isolator utilizes a unique multilayer structure incorporating a custom ultra-high permittivity dielectric, copper, and patterned silicon. Key results demonstrate that the isolator effectively mitigates detrimental coil-metamaterial coupling. Crucially, it achieves a substantial >11x enhancement of the local magnetic field intensity within the metamaterial, increasing it from 0.6 A/m to 7.0 A/m. This significant field boost, enabled by the isolator’s tailored electromagnetic properties, directly translates to potential gains in image signal-to-noise ratio (SNR). The design provides a promising solution for the safe and efficient integration of performance-enhancing metamaterials in clinical 1.5T MRI.

title: A Novel Hybrid Federated Learning and Digital Twin Approach for Secure and Adaptive AI in Healthcare IoT
authors: P Kanaka Tulasi, Bhukya Krishna, Manjula Devarakonda Venkata
publish: 2025 Third International Conference on Cyber Physical Systems, Power Electronics and Electric Vehicles (ICPEEV)
abstract: Through enhanced predictive analytics and patient management remote monitoring AI together with Internet of Things technology now drives healthcare transformation. Traditional AI models depend heavily on centralized data storage systems which produce privacy and security issues and scalability problems. The research develops a fresh fusion between Secure Digital Twin technology and Federated Learning to accomplish real-time adaptive learning while maintaining data privacy. The proposed method applies model compression for computation efficiency and block chain authentication for protected data transfers and secure MPC to boost confidentiality with reduced computational strain. By applying this framework to both the ECG PhysioNet dataset and AMIGOS multimodal wearable sensor data researchers see significant improvements. The results show a 92.3% accuracy rate alongside an 18.5% classification accuracy boost and 30% decreased communication overhead when compared to standard Federated Learning approaches. FL and DT integration enables this research to build an intelligent, scalable, privacy-protected healthcare IoT system which improves patient care and medical decision-making systems in real-time settings.

title: GaN-Based Hybrid Switched-Capacitor Converter for 48V Power Systems
authors: Xun Wang, Xiaoming Han, Ping Xie, Tiantian Mou, Ruochen Zhang, Fuen Huang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Electrical Engineering and Computer Technology (IC2ECT)
abstract: This paper presents an investigation of a hybrid switched-capacitor (HSC) converter that integrates a switchedcapacitor topology with an autotransformer. The design is specifically optimized for a fixed $4: 1$ voltage conversion ratio. Operating in a non-resonant mode, the proposed converter substantially simplifies both the transformer structure and the overall power-stage design. A detailed analysis of its operating principles is provided, along with the derivation of an equivalent model for the autotransformer. The analysis reveals that the leakage inductance of the transformer can effectively serve as the output filter inductance, thereby reducing the overall magnetic component volume. To validate the proposed concept, a $200-\mathrm{W}$ GaN-based HSC prototype was developed, achieving a peak efficiency of 97.14%.

title: Time Domain Physical Unclonable Functions in Silicon Nitride Ring Resonator Networks
authors: H. Sahoo, D. J. de Ruiter, L. van der Hoeven, D. Stellinga, M. C. Velsink, P. W. H. Pinkse
abstract: Time-domain physical unclonable functions (tPUFs) implemented in silicon nitride ring resonator networks exploit unavoidable manufacturing variations leading to spectro-temporal scrambling for fiber-based single-mode readout. We validate unclonability through correlation metrics across mirrored networks, demonstrate stability against thermal drift, and realize an analog tPEAC protocol and observed a peak pulse at one output channel. These results establish tPUFs as compact, robust photonic tokens for secure, remote authentication.

title: An electromagnetic exposure system based on microscopy
authors: Enjie Lv, Wanchun Yang, Yun Fang
publish: 2025 IEEE 8th International Symposium on Electromagnetic Compatibility (ISEMC)
abstract: To reduce the unevenness of electromagnetic exposure, improve exposure efficiency, and suppress the temperature rise of the culture medium, this study designed and manufactured an in vitro real-time electromagnetic exposure device based on a water jacket temperature control system. The device integrates an optical microscopy system, a 1.8GHz conformal antenna, and a water jacket temperature control unit. It can achieve an average specific absorption rate (SAR) of 10.95 W/kg under 0.5 W incident excitation, and the exposure unevenness can reach 12.77 %. Accurate temperature control of culture medium temperature fluctuation ≤ 0.1 ℃ can be achieved through active water circulation heat exchange mechanism under the condition of an average SAR of 10 W/kg. Realize synchronous and precise control of electromagnetic exposure and microscopic observation in non thermal effect research.

title: Numerical Analysis of Bandwidth in III-V Membrane MOSCAP Optical Phase Shifters
authors: Hiroya Sakumoto, Kasidit Toprasertpong, Mitsuru Takenaka
abstract: We numerically analyzed the bandwidth of III-V membrane MOSCAP optical phase shifters using a traveling-wave electrode model. By optimizing the structure of III-V layer and the electrodes, it was found that the electro-optic bandwidth exceeded 65 GHz with impedance and velocity matching.

title: Vulnerabilities and Layered Security Threats in LoRaWAN Systems: A Comprehensive Survey on Physical, MAC, and Application Layer Weaknesses
authors: Josemaria Chukwuemeka Osuorah, Sheikh Tareq Ahmed, Annamalai Annamalai, Mohamed Chouikha
abstract: LoRa has emerged as a leading Low Power Wide Area Network (LPWAN) technology, widely adopted for long-range communication, low energy consumption, and adaptability across diverse IoT applications. However, its lightweight design, optimized for constrained environments, exposes critical security vulnerabilities across multiple protocol layers. As deployments in agriculture, healthcare, smart cities, and industrial automation grow, understanding LoRa’s security posture has become imperative. This survey provides a comprehensive, layer-wise analysis of LoRa’s vulnerabilities and attack vectors, covering the physical, MAC, and application layers. It categorizes threats such as jamming, eavesdropping, replay attacks, key reuse, and packet injection, and examines adversary models and their capabilities. The paper also highlights emerging trends in leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) techniques for intrusion detection and anomaly recognition in LoRa-based systems. By consolidating technical findings and introducing a novel taxonomy of vulnerabilities and mitigations, this work contributes a structured reference for designing secure and resilient LoRa networks and guides future research directions.

title: Performance Evaluation Method for Complex Systems Based on Outcome-Oriented Correlated Evidence Reasoning
authors: Yijie Sun, Zhichao Feng, Zhijie Zhou
abstract: Performance evaluation is one of the most important methods to guarantee the safe and reliable operation of complex systems. Currently, there are three main problems in the performance evaluation of complex systems: the evaluation model is difficult to establish; the correlation between indicators is difficult to measure; and expert knowledge is not effectively incorporated. To solve these problems, this article proposes a performance evaluation model considering indicator correlation on the basis of considering the cohesion ratio factor evidence reasoning rule (ERr-CRC). In the process of calculating indicator correlations, expert knowledge is first used to determine whether there is a correlation between two indicators, and then an outcome-oriented correlation calculation method is proposed, which transforms the problem of calculating the correlation between indicators into the problem of calculating the correlation between the confidence distributions of each outcome level. On this basis, the order of evidence fusion is determined according to the size of the correlation factor, and it is integrated into the process of assigning the basic probability quality of evidence in the form of a global discount factor for the final performance evaluation. To prove the effectiveness of the correlation factor, this article carries out a sensitivity analysis and a perturbation analysis. Finally, a case study of the ERr-CRC model is conducted using the rocket structure state-aware simulation platform.

title: Unsupervised Representation Learning from Sparse Transformation Analysis
authors: Yue Song, T. Anderson Keller, Yisong Yue, Pietro Perona, Max Welling
publish: IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence
abstract: There is a vast literature on representation learning based on principles such as coding efficiency, statistical independence, causality, controllability, or symmetry. In this paper we propose to learn representations from sequence data by factorizing the transformations of the latent variables into sparse components. Input data are first encoded as distributions of latent activations and subsequently transformed using a probability flow model, before being decoded to predict a future input state. The flow model is decomposed into a number of rotational (divergence-free) vector fields and a number of potential flow (curl-free) fields. Our sparsity prior encourages only a small number of these fields to be active at any instant and infers the speed with which the probability flows along these fields. Training this model is completely unsupervised using a standard variational objective and results in a new form of disentangled representations where the input is not only represented by a combination of independent factors, but also by a combination of independent transformation primitives given by the learned flow fields. When viewing the transformations as symmetries one may interpret this as learning approximately equivariant representations. Empirically we demonstrate that this model achieves state of the art in terms of both data likelihood and unsupervised approximate equivariance errors on datasets composed of sequence transformations.

title: Latent Diffusion for Spectrum Sensing of Coexisting Radar and Communication Signals
authors: Thien Huynh-The, Phuoc-Long Huynh, Van-Ca Phan, Thai-Hoc Vu, Daniel Benevides da Costa
abstract: The growing demand for spectrum efficiency in next-generation wireless networks, especially in vehicular environments, necessitates effective spectrum sensing (SS) techniques capable of managing the coexistence of technologies like fifth generation new radio (NR) and radar systems. This paper introduces SpecDiff, an innovative framework based on latent diffusion models for spectrogram segmentation, designed to identify and differentiate these coexisting signals in dynamic, noisy environments. SpecDiff leverages a generative diffusion model in a compact latent space, using an attention-based denoising process to enhance segmentation performance under low signal-to-noise ratios and complex channel conditions. The model achieves state-of-the-art performance, with a mean accuracy of 98.68% and mean intersection-over-union (IoU) of 96.30%, effectively identifying the occupied bandwidth in spectrograms. Furthermore, SpecDiff surpasses existing deep learning models in both accuracy and efficiency, offering a promising solution for spectrum sharing in future wireless networks.

title: Computationally Efficient Model Predictive Control Based on Adaptive Switching States for Grid-Connected Three-Level ANPC Inverters
authors: Euntaek Nam, Suyong Chae
abstract: Finite control set model predictive control (FCS MPC) is regarded as one of the most powerful controllers for multilevel inverter systems. However, the FCS-MPC still suffers from a heavy computational burden due to its iterative computational process in the control loop. This article proposes a computationally efficient model predictive control (CE-MPC) based on adaptive switching states for grid-connected three-level active neutral-point-clamped (3L-ANPC) inverters. The proposed CE-MPC method optimizes the switching states of the 3L-ANPC inverter by applying three-step constraints of adaptive candidate vector boundary, small voltage vector polarity, and zero switching states operation mode. Therefore, the adaptively selected switching states reduce MPC computation time by up to 84.08% compared to the traditional FCS-MPC algorithm, effectively minimizing the computational burden and freeing up processing resources for other tasks. The feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed CE-MPC method are experimentally validated using a 3kW hardware prototype.

title: CLIP2RS: Leveraging Pretrained Vision-Language Model for Semantic Segmentation of Remote Sensing Images
authors: Yinghui Xing, Dexuan Kong, Shizhou Zhang, Ziyi Li, Qingyi Li, Yanning Zhang
publish: IEEE Transactions on Geoscience and Remote Sensing
abstract: Semantic segmentation of Remote Sensing (RS) images is a very challenging task due to the complicated characteristics such as diversity, complexity and massiveness. Current research endeavors are predominantly centered on utilizing visual context information exclusively through meticulous architecture design, often overlooking significant semantic details. This oversight limits the efficacy in tackling the challenge of intra-class variations. While in this paper, we propose CLIP2RS which is devised to leverage the pretrained Vision-Language Model (VLM) for semantic segmentation of RS images via the guidance of prior knowledge stored in the pretrained foundation model. Specifically, CLIP2RS utilizes a two-stage training strategy to overcome the domain gap challenge between natural images and remote sensing images. A dual-granularity alignment framework that simultaneously aligns pixel-level local features and image-level global features is designed to alleviate severe class sample imbalance problem. Additionally, a novel prompting mechanism is effectively explored to to fully harness the potential of CLIP textual descriptions. We conduct comprehensive experiments on the iSAID, Potsdam, and Vaihingen datasets, and the experimental results show that our proposed method achieves state-of-the-art performances, demonstrating its superiority.

title: Enhanced Thermal Stability and Reduced Specific Contact Resistivity in p-Type SiGe Ohmic Contact Through Ultrathin Mo Interlayer
authors: Haisu Gao, Jing Xu, Xu Chen, Jinbiao Liu, Jianhong Liu, Xianglie Sun, Jianfeng Gao, Shujuan Mao, Guilei Wang, Chao Zhao, Jun Luo
abstract: In this study, the thermal stability of silicides formed by the interaction of the Mo interlayer with Ti/TiN on p-type Si<inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">${}_{{0}.{8}}$</tex-math> </inline-formula>Ge<inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">${}_{{0}.{2}}$</tex-math> </inline-formula> was systematically investigated. The samples with stable silicides were subjected to rapid thermal annealing (RTA) for 60 s in the temperature range of <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$550~^{\circ }$</tex-math> </inline-formula>C–<inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$850~^{\circ }$</tex-math> </inline-formula>C. Compared to the sample without the Mo interlayer, the samples with the Mo interlayer exhibited superior contact characteristics at elevated temperatures, with a noticeable reduction in the specific contact resistivity (<inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"> <tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\boldsymbol {\rho } _{c}\text {)}$</tex-math> </inline-formula>. Moreover, the ultrathin Mo interlayer effectively suppressed Ge diffusion and maintained a well-defined interface morphology at high temperatures.

title: STMG-PCNet: A Lightweight Shape-Texture Mutual-Guided Predictor-Corrector Network for Infrared Small Target Detection
authors: Zichen Zhao, Huanzhang Ling, Xiaxia Qin, Haodong Xiao, Jihao Wu, Chengwei Liu
publish: IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote Sensing
abstract: Infrared small target detection (IRSTD) is rapidly advancing in edge applications such as micro-UAVs and autonomous vehicles. However, the small size and low brightness of targets often necessitate complex architectures in existing models, making deployment on resource-constrained edge devices challenging. Therefore, designing a model that balances high detection accuracy with low resource consumption is critical for the successful implementation of IRSTD. To address this challenge, this study proposes a lightweight shape-texture mutual-guided predictor-corrector network (STMG-PCNet). Through the collaborative design of a detection branch and a shape-aware branch, along with efficient module architectures, STMG-PCNet strikes a balance between accuracy and efficiency. Specifically, a progressive lightweight dilated dense (PLD<sup xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">2</sup>) module in the detection branch combines dense connections and cascaded multi-scale dilated convolutions to enhance local texture retention and precise localization. A shape-aware vision Transformer (SAViT) module in the shape-aware branch models target edges and shape features via global context interaction. In addition, a numerical predictor-corrector fusion (NPC-Fusion) module is proposed to achieve lightweight multi-stage feature fusion. Experiments on three public infrared datasets reveal that STMG-PCNet significantly outperforms existing algorithms in detection accuracy, parameters, computational efficiency, and inference speed, verifying its robustness and practicality in complex scenarios. Code is available at <uri xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">https://github.com/Zichen-Zhao01/STMG-PCNet</uri>.

title: Event-Based Fixed-Time Resilient Distributed Secondary Control in AC Microgrids against DoS Attacks
authors: Feisheng Yang, Yuanchao Fu, Yuhua Du
abstract: This article investigates the fixed-time secondary control problem for alternating current (AC) microgrids subjected to denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. Firstly, an acknowledgment character (ACK) detection mechanism is provided to identify the onset and cessation of intermittent DoS attack intervals. Then, a distributed fixed-time resilient protocol is proposed to rapidly achieve secondary control objectives via a novel lemma under the aperiodically intermittent control. Moreover, a dynamically event-based strategy is introduced into the design of controller to reduce command updates. Finally, real-time simulations on an OPAL-RT platform are performed to demonstrate the validity and effectiveness of the presented method against DoS attacks.

title: 2025 IEEE Photonics Conference (IPC) Welcome Message
authors: Gabriella Bosco
abstract: On behalf of the 2025 IEEE Photonics Conference (IPC) organizing committee, it is my pleasure to welcome you to the IEEE Photonics Society flagship conference taking place 9-13 November 2025 in Singapore. This year's program brings together the most recent advances in the areas of photonic sciences, technologies, and applications. The conference spans twelve topic areas, including photonic materials and devices, integrated photonics, nonlinear optics, nano-photonics, as well as bio-photonics, quantum photonics, optical AI, etc. In addition to a comprehensive technical program, IPC 2025 features several industrial panels as well as numerous networking and social events. We hope you will find this year's conference both inspiring and rewarding.

title: Enabling General and Efficient Window Mechanism for In-Network Telemetry
authors: Haifeng Sun, Jiaheng Li, Jintao He, Jie Gui, Qun Huang
abstract: Recent network telemetry solutions typically target programmable switches to achieve high performance and in-network visibility. They partition the packet stream into windows and then apply various stream processing techniques to summarize flow-level statistics. However, existing studies focus on the measurement within each window. Window management is still a missing piece due to the resource limitation of programmable switches. In this paper, we propose OmniWindow, a general and efficient window mechanism framework. OmniWindow splits the original window into fine-grained sub-windows such that the sub-windows can be merged into various window types. To deal with the resource restriction, OmniWindow carefully designs its data plane memory layout and proposes a window synchronization method. It also employs a collaborative architecture that can collect and reset stateful data in sub-windows within a limited time. We prototype OmniWindow on Tofino. We incorporate OmniWindow into a SOTA query-driven telemetry system and eight sketch-based telemetry algorithms. Our experiments demonstrate that OmniWindow enables these telemetry solutions to achieve higher accuracy than conventional window mechanism.
